sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.simpara: The PDF functions in PHP can create PDF files using the PDFlib library created by Thomas Merz. PDFlib is available for download at &url.pdf;, but requires that you purchase a license for commercial use. The JPEG and TIFF libraries are required to compile this extension. Please see the PDFlib installation section for more information about compiling PDF support into PHP.

The documentation in this section is only meant to be an overview of the available functions in the PDFlib library and should not be considered an exhaustive reference. Please consult the documentation included in the source distribution of PDFlib for the full and detailed explanation of each function here. It provides a very good overview of what PDFlib is capable of doing and contains the most up-to-date documentation of all functions.

All of the functions in PDFlib and the PHP module have identical function names and parameters. You will need to understand some of the basic concepts of PDF and PostScript to efficiently use this extension. All lengths and coordinates are measured in PostScript points. There are generally 72 PostScript points to an inch, but this depends on the output resolution. Please see the PDFlib documentation included with the source distribution of PDFlib for a more thorough explanation of the coordinate system used.
Please note that most of the PDF functions require a pdf object as it's first parameter. Please see the examples below for more information.

note.para: An alternative PHP module for PDF document creation based on FastIO's ClibPDF is available. Please see the ClibPDF section for details. Note that ClibPDF has a slightly different API compared to PDFlib.

sect1.title: Confusion with old PDFlib versions
sect1.simpara: Starting with PHP 4.0.5, the PHP extension for PDFlib is officially supported by PDFlib GmbH. This means that all the functions described in the PDFlib manual (V3.00 or greater) are supported by PHP 4 with exactly the same meaning and the same parameters. Only the return values may differ from the PDFlib manual, because the PHP convention of returning &false; was adopted. For compatibility reasons this binding for PDFlib still supports the old functions, but they should be replaced by their new versions. PDFlib GmbH will not support any problems arising from the use of these deprecated functions.

row.entry: Old function
Replacement
Not needed anymore.
Not needed anymore.
pdf_get_bookmark using the same parameters.
pdf_get_value passing "font" as the second parameter.
pdf_get_value passing "fontsize" as the second parameter.

pdf_set_info passing "Title" as the second parameter.

pdf_set_value passing "textrendering" as the second parameter.
pdf_set_value passing "textrise" as the second parameter.

pdf_open_image_file passing "tiff" as the second parameter.
pdf_open_image_file passing "png" as the second parameter.
pdf_get_value passing "imagewidth" as the second parameter and the image as the third parameter.
pdf_get_value passing "imageheight" as the second parameter and the image as the third parameter.

sect1.title: PDFlib 3.x Installation Hints
sect1.simpara: When using version 3.x of PDFlib, you should configure PDFlib with the option --enable-shared-pdflib.

sect1.title: Issues with older versions of PDFlib
sect1.simpara: Any version of PHP 4 after March 9, 2000 does not support versions of PDFlib older than 3.0.
PDFlib 3.0 or greater is supported by PHP 3.0.19 and later.

sect1.title: Examples
sect1.simpara: Most of the functions are fairly easy to use. The most difficult part is probably creating a very simple PDF document at all. The following example should help to get started. It creates test.pdf with one page. The page contains the text "Times Roman outlined" in an outlined, 30pt font. The text is also underlined.

example.title: Creating a PDF document with PDFlib
example.programlisting: finished"; ?>
example.simpara: The script getpdf.php just returns the pdf document.

informalexample.programlisting:
<?php
$len = filesize($filename);
header("Content-type: application/pdf");
header("Content-Length: $len");
header("Content-Disposition: inline; filename=foo.pdf");
readfile($filename);
?>

sect1.para: The PDFlib distribution contains a more complex example which creates a page with an analog clock. Here we use the in memory creation feature of PDFlib to alleviate the need to use temporary files. The example, converted to PHP from the PDFlib example, is as follows: (The same example is available in the CLibPDF documentation.)

example.title: pdfclock example from PDFlib distribution
example.programlisting:
<?php
$radius = 200;
$margin = 20;
$pagecount = 10;

$pdf = pdf_new();

if (!pdf_open_file($pdf, "")) {
    print error;
    exit;
};

pdf_set_parameter($pdf, "warning", "true");

pdf_set_info($pdf, "Creator", "pdf_clock.php");
pdf_set_info($pdf, "Author", "Uwe Steinmann");
pdf_set_info($pdf, "Title", "Analog Clock");

while($pagecount-- > 0) {
    pdf_begin_page($pdf, 2 * ($radius + $margin), 2 * ($radius + $margin));

    pdf_set_parameter($pdf, "transition", "wipe");
    pdf_set_value($pdf, "duration", 0.5);
  
    pdf_translate($pdf, $radius + $margin, $radius + $margin);
    pdf_save($pdf);
    pdf_setrgbcolor($pdf, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);

    /* minute strokes */
    pdf_setlinewidth($pdf, 2.0);
    for ($alpha = 0; $alpha < 360; $alpha += 6) {
        pdf_rotate($pdf, 6.0);
        pdf_moveto($pdf, $radius, 0.0);
        pdf_lineto($pdf, $radius-$margin/3, 0.0);
        pdf_stroke($pdf);
    }

    pdf_restore($pdf);
    pdf_save($pdf);

    /* 5 minute strokes */
    pdf_setlinewidth($pdf, 3.0);
    for ($alpha = 0; $alpha < 360; $alpha += 30) { 
        pdf_rotate($pdf, 30.0);
        pdf_moveto($pdf, $radius, 0.0);
        pdf_lineto($pdf, $radius-$margin, 0.0);
        pdf_stroke($pdf);
    }

    $ltime = getdate();

    /* draw hour hand */
    pdf_save($pdf);
    pdf_rotate($pdf,-(($ltime['minutes']/60.0)+$ltime['hours']-3.0)*30.0);
    pdf_moveto($pdf, -$radius/10, -$radius/20);
    pdf_lineto($pdf, $radius/2, 0.0);
    pdf_lineto($pdf, -$radius/10, $radius/20);
    pdf_closepath($pdf);
    pdf_fill($pdf);
    pdf_restore($pdf);

    /* draw minute hand */
    pdf_save($pdf);
    pdf_rotate($pdf,-(($ltime['seconds']/60.0)+$ltime['minutes']-15.0)*6.0);
    pdf_moveto($pdf, -$radius/10, -$radius/20);
    pdf_lineto($pdf, $radius * 0.8, 0.0);
    pdf_lineto($pdf, -$radius/10, $radius/20);
    pdf_closepath($pdf);
    pdf_fill($pdf);
    pdf_restore($pdf);

    /* draw second hand */
    pdf_setrgbcolor($pdf, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0);
    pdf_setlinewidth($pdf, 2);
    pdf_save($pdf);
    pdf_rotate($pdf, -(($ltime['seconds'] - 15.0) * 6.0));
    pdf_moveto($pdf, -$radius/5, 0.0);
    pdf_lineto($pdf, $radius, 0.0);
    pdf_stroke($pdf);
    pdf_restore($pdf);

    /* draw little circle at center */
    pdf_circle($pdf, 0, 0, $radius/30);
    pdf_fill($pdf);

    pdf_restore($pdf);

    pdf_end_page($pdf);

    # to see some difference
    sleep(1);
}

pdf_close($pdf);

$buf = pdf_get_buffer($pdf);
$len = strlen($buf);

header("Content-type: application/pdf");
header("Content-Length: $len");
header("Content-Disposition: inline; filename=foo.pdf");
print $buf;

pdf_delete($pdf);
?>

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: pdf_add_outline is replaced by pdf_add_note
See also pdf_add_note.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a nested bookmark under parent, or a new top-level bookmark if parent = 0. Returns a bookmark descriptor which may be used as parent for subsequent nested bookmarks. If open = 1, child bookmarks will be folded out, and invisible if open = 0.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a launch annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a launch annotation (to a target of arbitrary file type).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a link annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a link annotation to a target within the current PDF file.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a note annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a note annotation. icon is one of of "comment, "insert", "note", "paragraph", "newparagraph", "key", or "help".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Deprecated: Adds bookmark for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See pdf_add_bookmark.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adds file link annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a file link annotation (to a PDF target).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add an existing image as thumbnail for the current page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a weblink annotation to a target URL on the Web.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a counterclockwise circular arc from alpha to beta degrees
See also: pdf_arcn

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a clockwise circular arc from alpha to beta degrees
See also: pdf_arc

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adds a file attachement for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a file attachment annotation. icon is one of "graph, "paperclip", "pushpin", or "tag".

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a new page to the document.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Starts a new pattern definition and returns a pattern handle. width, and height define the bounding box for the pattern. xstep and ystep give the repeated pattern offsets. painttype=1 means that the pattern has its own colour settings whereas a value of 2 indicates that the current colour is used when the pattern is applied.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Start a new template definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a circle with center (x, y) and radius r.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the current path as clipping path.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the generated PDF file, and free all document-related resources.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the current path.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Closes, fills and strokes current path

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the path, fill, and stroke it.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Closes path and draws line along path

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the path, and stroke it.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close an image retrieved with one of the pdf_open_image* functions.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close all open page handles, and close the input PDF document.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the page handle, and free all page-related resources.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Concatenate a matrix to the CTM

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Concatenate a matrix to the CTM.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Print text at the next line. The spacing between lines is determined by the leading parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a Bezier curve from the current point, using 3 more control points.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Delete the PDF object, and free all internal resources.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Finish the page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated, use one of the stroke, fill, or clip functions instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Finish the pattern definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Finish the template definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Fill the interior of the path with the current fill color.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Fill and stroke the path with the current fill and stroke color.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Prepare font for later use with pdf_setfont.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Prepare a font for later use with pdf_setfont. The metrics will be loaded, and if embed is nonzero, the font file will be checked, but not yet used. Encoding is one of "builtin", "macroman", "winansi", "host", or a user-defined encoding name, or the name of a CMap.
pdf_findfont returns a font handle or &false; on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetch the buffer containig the generated PDF data.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of the PDF output buffer. The result must be used by the client before calling any other PDFlib function.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See pdf_get_value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See pdf_get_parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See pdf_get_value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: pdf_get_image_height is deprecated, use pdf_get_value instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The pdf_get_image_width is deprecated, use pdf_get_value instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of some PDFlib parameter with string type.

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current point.

refsect1.title: Description

refnamediv.refpurpose: Deprecated: Open a new pdf object

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: pdf_open is deprecated, use pdf_new plus pdf_open_file instead.
See also pdf_new, pdf_open_file.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens a new image file with raw CCITT data

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Open a raw CCITT image.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Create a new PDF file using the supplied file name. If filename is empty the PDF document will be generated in memory instead of on file. The result must be fetched by the client with the pdf_get_buffer function.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See pdf_open_image,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use image data from a variety of data sources. Supported types are "jpeg", "ccitt", "raw". Supported sources are "memory", "fileref", "url". len is only used for type="raw", params is only used for type="ccitt".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Reads an image from a file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Open an image file. Supported types are "jpeg", "tiff", "gif", and "png". stringparam is either "", "mask", "masked", or "page". intparamis either 0, the image id of the applied mask, or the page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See also pdf_open_image,

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens an image created with PHP's image functions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See also pdf_close_image, pdf_place_image.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Open an existing PDF document for later use.

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated.
See pdf_open_image.

refsect1.title: Description

See also pdf_open_image,

refnamediv.refpurpose: Places an image on the page

refsect1.title: Description

refnamediv.refpurpose: Places an image on the page

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Restore the most recently saved graphics state.

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets fill and stroke color to CMYK values

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current color space and color. The parameter type can be "fill", "stroke", or "both" to specify that the color is set for filling, stroking or both filling and stroking. The parameter colorspace can be gray, rgb, cmyk, spot or pattern. The parameters c1, c2, c3 and c4 represent the color components for the color space specified by colorspace. For gray only c1 is used. For rgb parameters c1, c2, and c3 specify the Red, Green amd Blue values respectively. For cmyk parameters c1, c2, c3, and c4 specify the Cyan, Magenta, Yellow and Black values respectively. For spot c1 specifies a spot color handles returned by pdf_makespotcolor and c2 specifies a tint value between 0 and 1. For pattern c1 specifies a pattern handle returned by pdf_begin_pattern.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current dash pattern to b black and w white units.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the flatness to a value between 0 and 100 inclusive.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current font in the given size, using a font handle returned by pdf_findfont
See Also: pdf_findfont.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing and filling color to gray value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current fill and stroke color.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Deprecated, use pdf_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets filling color to gray value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current fill color to a gray value between 0 and 1 inclusive.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Deprecated, use pdf_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing color to gray value

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description

refsect1.title: Description

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing and filling color to rgb color value

refsect1.title: Description

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Deprecated, use pdf_setcolor instead.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Deprecated, use pdf_setcolor instead.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Deprecated, use pdf_setcolor instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Print text in the current font and size at the current position.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Format text in the current font and size into the supplied text box according to the requested formatting mode, which must be one of "left", "right", "center", "justify", or "fulljustify". If width and height are 0, only a single line is placed at the point (left, top) in the requested mode.
Returns the number of characters that did not fit in the specified box. Returns 0 if all characters fit or the width and height parameters were set to 0 for single-line formattting.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Print text in the current font at (x, y).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Skew the coordinate system in x and y direction by alpha and beta degrees.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns width of text using current font

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the width of text using the last font set by pdf_setfont. If the optional parameters font and size are specified, the width will be calculated using that font and size instead. Please note that font is a font handle returned by pdf_findfont.

note.para: Both the font and size parameters must used together.

refsect1.para: See Also: pdf_setfont and pdf_findfont.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Stroke the path with the current color and line width, and clear it.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Translate the origin of the coordinate system.
